summary: This is an email from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to prosecutors regarding a security breach on the MDC Zoom platform used for attorney-client communications with Ghislaine Maxwell. Sternheim reports that third parties accessed the Zoom room, compromising privileged communications, and requests a return to the WebEx platform controlled by her law firm.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who is raising concerns about a security breach on the MDC Zoom platform that compromised privileged attorney-client communications.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the high-profile case whose privileged attorney-client communications were breached when third parties accessed the MDC Zoom room.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Recipient of the email, presumably a prosecutor on the case, though not explicitly titled in this excerpt.

connections.description: Sternheim is the defense attorney representing Maxwell, as evidenced by her raising concerns about breaches to their privileged communications.
Sternheim is communicating with Everdell, presumably a prosecutor, regarding case logistics and security concerns.

events.title: Security breach on MDC Zoom platform
events.description: Third parties accessed the Zoom room used by Ghislaine Maxwell and her counsel for attorney-client communications, compromising privileged information.

events.title: Initial concern raised about MDC Zoom
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email expressing concerns that the MDC Zoom platform did not prevent third parties with access information from interfering with privileged communications.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: A security breach occurred on August 12, 2021, when third parties accessed the MDC Zoom room used for Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney-client communications.
Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim reported the breach to prosecutors and requested an immediate reversion to the WebEx platform controlled by her law firm, Cohen & Gresser.
Sternheim had previously raised concerns on August 9, 2021, about the MDC Zoom platform's vulnerability to third-party interference.
The breach severely impacted confidential privileged attorney-client communication, which is especially concerning given the high-profile nature of the case.
